lines.text: [first lines]

The film which you are about to see is an account of the tragedy which befell a group of five youths, in particular Sally Hardesty and her invalid brother, Franklin. It is all the more tragic in that they were young. But, had they lived very, very long lives, they could not have expected nor would they have wished to see as much of the mad and macabre as they were to see that day. For them an idyllic summer afternoon drive became a nightmare. The events of that day were to lead to the discovery of one of the most bizarre crimes in the annals of American history, The Texas Chain Saw Massacre.
I just can't take no pleasure in killing. There's just some things you gotta do. Don't mean you have to like it.
Look what your brother did to the door! Ain't he got no pride in his home?
You could have dinner with us... my brother makes good head cheese! You like head cheese?
[last lines]
Go! Go!
My family's always been in meat.
Look... I got some good barbecue here!
Hi, Mister. Would you fill 'er up, please?
I got no gas.
What? You're all out of gas?
My tank's empty! Transport woun't be here until late this afteroon. Mayby not even 'til tomorrow morning.
Hey, do you know where the old Franklin place is?
The old Franklin place?
Yeah, it's an old two-story rock house that sitting up on a hill. I thought it might be back on that road someplace, but I'm not really sure.
Uh... yeah, maybe I've seen something like that up that way. Well now look, you boys don't want to go messin' around some old house. Those things is dangerous. You're liable to get hurt.
We'll be careful.
No, seriously. You don't want to go fooling around other folks' property. If some folks don't like it... they don't mind showing you.

[Sarcastically]
HE HE HE! Come on Franklin! It's gonna be a fun trip! HE! If I have anymore fun today, I don't think I'm gonna be able to take it!

[refering to the Hitchhiker]
I think we just picked up Dracula.
That's the last goddamn hitchhiker I ever pick up.
Shut up you bitch hog!
You just shut up and remember you're just the cook! And me and him'll handle this!
Shut your mouth!
If I have any more fun today I don't think I can take it!
Those girls... those girls don't wanna go messin' round no old house!
Hey man, you ever go in that slaughter room or whatever they call it? The place where they shoot cattle in the head with that big air gun?
Oh, that gun's no good.
I was in there once with my uncle.
The old way... with a sledge! You see that way's better. They die better that way.
Well how come? I thought the gun was better.
Oh, no. With the new way... people were put out of jobs.
Did you do that?

[digs through pouch for a few pictures]
Look!
[Hands them to Franklin]
I was the killer!

[looking at the pictures]
Damn...
So, where you heading, man?
South.
You work at that place? The slaughter house?
Uh... no.
How'd you get stuck way out here?
I was at the slaughter house.
I got an uncle who works in a slaughter house.
I used to work there. My brother did too. My grandfather too. My family's always been in meat!

[quietly to Sally]
A whole family of Draculas!
[Kirk and Pam arrive at a large hole in the ground where a pond used to be]
This must be it. The water hole. If Franklin's been a criple all his life, how do you suppose he got down here in his wheelchair?
I don't know. Maybe somebody carried him when he was little.
Franklin never was "little".
[to the captive Sally in his truck]
Sorry to keep you waiting, young lady. I had to lock up the shop and turn the lights off. The cost of electricity these days is enough to drive a man like me out of business.

[when they arrive at the old house, upon seeing its condition]
Oh, I wish they hadn't let the place fall apart.
Now it looks like the birthplace of Bela Lugosi.
They just shoot a bolt in their head, and then retract it. It's just BOOM-shht-BOOM-shht.
Franklin, I like meat. Please change the subject!

[to Leatherface]
You... you damn fool! You ruined the door!

[to Sally]
And, and I thought YOU was in a hurry!

[to Sally]
There's no need to do that!

[to Sally]
Just take it easy now.

the remains of a badly decomposed corpse wired to a large monument. A second body was found in a ditch near the perimeter of the cemetery. Subsequent investigation has revealed at least a dozen empty crypts, and it's feared more will turn up as the probe continues. Deputies report that in some instances only parts of a corpse have been removed, the head or in some cases the extremities removed, the remainder of the corpse left intact. Evidence indicates the robberies have occurred over a period of time. Sheriff Jesús Maldonado refused to give details in the ghoulish case, and said only that he did have evidence linking the crime to elements outside the state. Area residents have reportedly been converging on the cemetery, fearing the remains of relatives have been removed. No suspects are in custody as the investigation at the scene continues.

[laughs]
Things happen here about, they don't tell about. I see things. You see, they say that it's just an old man talking. You laugh at an old man, it's them that laughs and knows better.
[laughs again]

[to Leatherface, who investigates Sally at the dinner table]
You like this face?
Come on guys, quit goofing on me.
Have you been doing those Reader's Digest 'Word-Power' columns again?

[when approaching a slaughterhouse]
What's that stench?

Hey, listen to Franklin's horoscope. "Travel in the country, long-range plans, and upsetting persons around you, could make this a disturbing and unpredictiable day. The events in the world are not doing much either to cheer one up."
That's just perfect. And now read Sally's.

[reading from the American Astrology book]
Oh, no. Capricorn's ruled by Saturn. "There are moments when we cannot believe that what is happening is really true. Pinch yourself and you may find out that it is."

[to Sally]
Why, my old grandpa was the best killer there was at the slaughterhouse. Why, it never took more than one lick they say. Why, he did 60 cattle in five minutes once. They say he could have done more if the hook and pull gang could have gotten the beeves out of the way faster.
